mutants.mutated_line: len_cycle = [0] / current_n
mutants.code:
def longest_simple_cycle_length(t, n, c, a, b):
    results = []
    for test_case in range(t):
        current_n = n[test_case]
        current_c = c[test_case]
        current_a = a[test_case]
        current_b = b[test_case]
        len_cycle = [0] / current_n
        for i in range(1, current_n):
            d = abs(current_b[i] - current_a[i])
            len_cycle[i] = current_c[i] + 1 + int(d != 0) * max(d, len_cycle[i - 1] - d)
        results.append(max(len_cycle))
    return results

mutants.mutated_line: len_cycle = [0] + current_n

def longest_simple_cycle_length(t, n, c, a, b):
    results = []
    for test_case in range(t):
        current_n = n[test_case]
        current_c = c[test_case]
        current_a = a[test_case]
        current_b = b[test_case]
        len_cycle = [0] * current_n
        for i in range(1, current_n):
            d = abs(current_b[i] - current_a[i])
            len_cycle[i] = current_c[i] + 1 + int(d != 0) * max(d, len_cycle[i + 1] - d)
        results.append(max(len_cycle))
    return results

def longest_simple_cycle_length(t, n, c, a, b):
    results = []
    for test_case in range(t):
        current_n = n[test_case]
        current_c = c[test_case]
        current_a = a[test_case]
        current_b = b[test_case]
        len_cycle = [0] * current_n
        for i in range(1, current_n):
            d = abs(current_b[i] - current_a[i])
            len_cycle[i] = current_c[i] + 1 + int(d != 0) * max(d, len_cycle[i - -1] - d)
        results.append(max(len_cycle))
    return results
